intro: Solanum campylacanthum subsp. beniense, commonly known as the Beniense nightshade, is a shrub native to the Andean regions of South America. It is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with a serrated margin. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by berries that turn from green to red as they mature. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, temperate climates. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
